column5: This winter I finally did it, and bought a( new to me) bass boat. Been wantig one for 15 years now. No more tiller for me...Went out Monday for a pike day and the fish were on fire. My buddy and I caught more than 50 pike between 4 and 7 lbs. Boat ran well and the fishing was good.
Good stuff Larry. I'm glad things are going well for you. Beauty fish too!
50 pike that's a good season for me and you and your buddy got them all in one outing. Nice going fellas
Super job Larry Great looking gators    and congratulations on the new boat!!! Leechman
sweet job ice them Arm's up for your next outing.  Is that a triton? beauty boat anyways
some nice looking pike Larry, but that fish in your avatar would have 'em for breakfast, that thing is a monster. Congrats on the new boat
Talk about off to a good start, nice...

definitely 'christened' the new boat with a good dose of slime......excellent job, new boat and 50+ pike...gotta be lovin' that!  Now i also know how long it will take before i can get a new boat...15yrs....it will pass quickly....lol.  Thanks for sharing.  (cant see much of it, but the boat looks great from what i can see)
Great report and pics LL!!!  50+ Pike is a helluva day!!! What was the lure of choice, if you don't mind me askin'?  Should't there be 50+ Pike pics in your report?
N I C E ! ! ! ! I'm hoping to get into some pike action on my new boat (new to me) on Sunday up on G Bay.
GCD, the water is still cold so something that stays in their face alittle longer than usual is whats needed....husky jerks and weighted soft jerk baits  were the baits of choice...
You don't know the half of it, young fella.  JF
What a great way to break the new boat in....SLIME  ...nice pike!!
